sentence.Network_en: Buying budget-priced furniture needn't mean compromising on quality or style.
sentence.Network_cn: 买价钱经济的家具并不意味着就要牺牲质量和样式。

sentence.Network_en: The Budget does expose the lies ministers were telling a year ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 预算案无疑揭穿了部长们一年前所说的谎话。

sentence.Network_en: The change proposed last month was foreshadowed in the March Budget.
sentence.Network_cn: 上个月提议的变动在3月份的预算中已经有所预兆了。

jx.jx_en_mean: with a restricted amount of money

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French bougette, diminutive of bouge 'leather bag', from Latin bulga 'leather bag, knapsack', of Gaulish origin. Compare with bulge The word originally meant a pouch or wallet, and later its contents. In the mid 18th cent., the Chancellor of the Exchequer, in presenting his annual statement, was said ‘to open the budget’ . In the late 19th cent. the use of the term was extended from governmental to private or commercial finances

entry.def: Your budget is the amount of money that you have available to spend. The budget for something is the amount of money that a person, organization, or country has available to spend on it.

example.ex: She will design a fantastic new kitchen for you — and all within your budget...
example.tran: 她将为你设计一个超级棒的新厨房，而且绝不会超出你的预算。

example.ex: Someone had furnished the place on a tight budget...
example.tran: 有人没花多少钱简单地把这个地方布置了一下。

entry.def: The budget of an organization or country is its financial situation, considered as the difference between the money it receives and the money it spends.

example.ex: The hospital obviously needs to balance the budget each year.
example.tran: 很明显，医院每年都要平衡其收支预算。

example.ex: ...his readiness to raise taxes as part of an effort to cut the budget deficit.
example.tran: 他已准备把增加税收作为削减预算赤字的措施之一

entry.tran: （英国的）政府年度预算案，政府年度预算演讲
entry.def: In Britain, the Budget is the financial plan in which the government states how much money it intends to raise through taxes and how it intends to spend it. The Budget is also the speech in which this plan is announced.

example.ex: The Chancellor could use the Budget to bring in taxation reforms.
example.tran: 财政大臣可以利用政府年度预算演讲的机会提出税收改革事宜。

example.ex: ...other indirect tax changes announced in the Budget.
example.tran: 在政府预算中公布的其他间接税收变动

entry.def: If you budget certain amounts of money for particular things, you decide that you can afford to spend those amounts on those things.

example.ex: The company has budgeted $10 million for advertising...
example.tran: 公司已经做了1,000万美元的广告预算。

example.ex: The movie is only budgeted at $10 million...
example.tran: 该电影的预算只有1,000万美元。

entry.def: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply.

example.ex: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agent from £240.
example.tran: 收费低廉的旅行社可以提供240英镑起的低价机票。

means.word_mean: 1. a sum of money allocated for a particular purpose;

sentences.sentence: "the laboratory runs on a budget of a million a year"

means.word_mean: 2. a summary of intended expenditures along with proposals for how to meet them;

sentences.sentence: "the president submitted the annual budget to Congress"

Sentence.sentence: make efforts to reach agreement on their family budgets
Industrial scientists tend to receive training that academics do not, such as how to build a multidisciplinary team, manage budgets and negotiate contracts.
They are a vital part of an array of data that we use to assess if we're doing well or doing badly, and that in turn shapes government policies and corporate budgets and personal spending decisions.
Present budget policies tax parents heavily to support the elderly
Budget reduction in around the corner.

sentences.en: a monthly/ an annual/ a family budget
We decorated the house on a tight budget.
sentences.cn: 我们节省地装修了房子。

sentences.en: The work was finished on time and within budget
sentences.cn: 工作按时完成且未超出预算。

sentences.en: tax cuts in this year's budget
sentences.cn: 本年度政府预算中的税收削减

sentences.en: I‘ve budgeted for two new member of staff.
sentences.cn: 我已经把两名新职员的名额编入预算了。

sentences.en: Ten million francs has been budgeted for the project.
sentences.cn: 一千万法郎已经计算在这个工程的预算里了。

sentences.en: The project has been budgeted at ten million francs.
sentences.cn: 该工程已制定一千万法郎的预算。

sentences.en: If we budget carefully we'll able to afford the trip.
sentences.cn: 如果精打细算一点，我们就能负担得起这次旅行。

sentences.en: We couldn't budget for every emergency.
sentences.cn: 我们不能为每个紧急需要做安排。

jushi.english: Rising budget deficit is beginning to bite.
jushi.chinese: 预算赤字的不断增加开始产生不良后果。

jushi.english: Our budget has been pared to the bone.
jushi.chinese: 我们的预算已削减到最低限度。

jushi.english: The Chancellor of Exchequer will present his budget to Parliament tomorrow.
jushi.chinese: 财政大臣明天将向议会提出预算案。
